description: From Middle English prollen, of unknown origin.

examples: I'm going on a midnight prowl.

verbs.description: prowl (third-person singular simple present prowls, present participle prowling, simple past and past participle prowled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To rove over, through, or about in a stealthy manner; especially, to search in, as for prey or booty.
examples: Watch the lioness prowling in the shrubbery for zebras.
It's easy to sneak vandalism into Wiktionary as there are few other users prowling the Recent Changes page.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To idle; to go about aimlessly.
examples: That dandy has nothing better to do than prowl around town all day in his pinstripe suit.
